lz.cpp

00001 /* LZ.C
00002  This file contains the functions which decompress the graphics
00003  data from Keen 1.
00004  */
00005 #include "../CLogFile.h"
00006 #include <cstdio>
00007 
00008 #define LZ_STARTBITS        9
00009 #define LZ_ERRORCODE        256
00010 #define LZ_EOFCODE          257
00011 #define LZ_DICTSTARTCODE    258
00012 
00013 #define LZ_MAXSTRINGSIZE    72
00014 
00015 unsigned char *lz_outbuffer;
00016 
00017 typedef struct stLZDictionaryEntry
00018 {
00019  int stringlen;
00020  unsigned char string[LZ_MAXSTRINGSIZE];
00021 } stLZDictionaryEntry;
00022 
00023 stLZDictionaryEntry **lzdict;
00024 
00025 // reads a word of length numbits from file lzfile.
00026 unsigned int lz_readbits(FILE *lzfile, unsigned char numbits, unsigned char reset)
00027 {
00028  static int mask, byte;
00029  unsigned char bitsread;
00030  unsigned int dat;
00031  /*unsigned int posit, mult*/;
00032  
00033  if (reset)
00034  {
00035   mask = 0;
00036   byte = 0;
00037   return 0;
00038  }
00039  
00040  bitsread = 0;
00041  dat = 0;
00042  do
00043  {
00044         if (!mask)
00045         {
00046    byte = fgetc(lzfile);
00047    mask = 0x80;
00048         }
00049   
00050         if (byte & mask)
00051         {
00052    dat |= 1 << ((numbits - bitsread) - 1);
00053         }
00054   
00055         mask >>= 1;
00056         bitsread++;
00057  } while(bitsread<numbits);
00058  
00059  return dat;
00060 }
00061 
00062 // writes dictionary entry 'entry' to the output buffer
00063 void lz_outputdict(int entry)
00064 {
00065  int i;
00066  
00067  for(i=0;i<lzdict[entry]->stringlen;i++)
00068  {
00069   *lz_outbuffer = lzdict[entry]->string[i];
00070   lz_outbuffer++;
00071  }
00072 }
00073 
00074 // decompresses LZ data from open file lzfile into buffer outbuffer
00075 // returns nonzero if an error occurs
00076 char lz_decompress(FILE *lzfile, unsigned char *outbuffer)
00077 {
00078  unsigned int i;
00079  unsigned int numbits;
00080  unsigned int decsize;
00081  unsigned short maxdictcodewords;
00082  unsigned int maxdictsize;
00083  unsigned int dictindex, maxdictindex;
00084  unsigned int lzcode,lzcode_save,lastcode;
00085  char addtodict;
00086  
00087  // Get the decompressed file-size
00088  decsize = fgetc(lzfile);
00089  decsize += fgetc(lzfile) << 8;
00090  decsize += fgetc(lzfile) << 16;
00091  decsize += fgetc(lzfile) << 24;
00092  
00093  // Get the length of the maximum dictionary size
00094  
00095  maxdictcodewords = fgetc(lzfile);
00096  maxdictcodewords += fgetc(lzfile) << 8;
00097  
00098  maxdictsize = ((1<<maxdictcodewords)+1);
00099  
00100  lzdict = new stLZDictionaryEntry*[maxdictsize];
00101  // allocate memory for the LZ dictionary
00102  for(i=0;i<maxdictsize;i++)
00103  {
00104   lzdict[i] = new stLZDictionaryEntry;
00105   if (!lzdict[i])
00106   {
00107    g_pLogFile->textOut("lz_decompress(): unable to allocate memory for dictionary!<br>");
00108    return 1;
00109   }
00110  }
00111  
00112  /* initilize the dictionary */
00113  
00114  // entries 0-255 start with a single character corresponding
00115  // to their entry number
00116  for(i=0;i<256;i++)
00117  {
00118   lzdict[i]->stringlen = 1;
00119   lzdict[i]->string[0] = i;
00120  }
00121  // 256+ start undefined
00122  for(i=256;i<maxdictsize;i++)
00123  {
00124   lzdict[i]->stringlen = 0;
00125  }
00126  
00127  // reset readbits
00128  lz_readbits(NULL, 0, 1);
00129  
00130  // set starting # of bits-per-code
00131  numbits = LZ_STARTBITS;
00132  maxdictindex = (1 << numbits) - 1;
00133  
00134  // point the global pointer to the buffer we were passed
00135  lz_outbuffer = outbuffer;
00136  
00137  // setup where to start adding strings to the dictionary
00138  dictindex = LZ_DICTSTARTCODE;
00139  addtodict = 1;                    // enable adding to dictionary
00140  
00141  // read first code
00142  lastcode = lz_readbits(lzfile, numbits, 0);
00143  lz_outputdict(lastcode);
00144  do
00145  {
00146   // read the next code from the compressed data stream
00147   lzcode = lz_readbits(lzfile, numbits, 0);
00148   lzcode_save = lzcode;
00149   
00150   if (lzcode==LZ_ERRORCODE || lzcode==LZ_EOFCODE)
00151    break;
00152   
00153   // if the code is present in the dictionary,
00154   // lookup and write the string for that code, then add the
00155   // last string + the first char of the just-looked-up string
00156   // to the dictionary at dictindex
00157   
00158   // if not in dict, add the last string + the first char of the
00159   // last string to the dictionary at dictindex (which will be equal
00160   // to lzcode), then lookup and write string lzcode.
00161   
00162   if (lzdict[lzcode]->stringlen==0)
00163    // code is not present in dictionary
00164    lzcode = lastcode;
00165   
00166   if (addtodict)     // room to add more entries to the dictionary?
00167   {
00168    // copies string lastcode to string dictindex, then
00169    // concatenates the first character of string lzcode.
00170    for(i=0 ; i< (unsigned int) lzdict[lastcode]->stringlen ; i++)
00171     lzdict[dictindex]->string[i] = lzdict[lastcode]->string[i];
00172    
00173    lzdict[dictindex]->string[i] = lzdict[lzcode]->string[0];
00174    lzdict[dictindex]->stringlen = (lzdict[lastcode]->stringlen + 1);
00175    
00176    // ensure we haven't overflowed the buffer
00177    if (lzdict[dictindex]->stringlen >= (LZ_MAXSTRINGSIZE-1))
00178    {
00179     g_pLogFile->ftextOut("lz_decompress(): lzdict[%d]->stringlen is too long...max length is %d<br>", dictindex, LZ_MAXSTRINGSIZE);
00180     return 1;
00181    }
00182    
00183    dictindex++;
00184    if (dictindex >= maxdictindex)
00185    { // no more entries can be specified with current code bit-width
00186     if (numbits < maxdictcodewords)
00187     {  // increase width of codes
00188      numbits++;
00189      maxdictindex = (1 << numbits) - 1;
00190     }
00191     else
00192     {
00193      // reached maximum bit width, can't increase.
00194      // use the final entry (4095) before we shut off
00195      // adding items to the dictionary.
00196      if (dictindex>=(maxdictsize-1)) addtodict = 0;
00197     }
00198    }
00199   }
00200   
00201   // write the string associated with the original code read.
00202   // if the code wasn't present, it now should have been added.
00203   lz_outputdict(lzcode_save);
00204   
00205   lastcode = lzcode_save;
00206  } while(1);
00207  
00208  /* free the memory used by the LZ dictionary */
00209  for(i=0;i<maxdictsize;i++)
00210   delete lzdict[i];
00211  
00212  delete [] lzdict;
00213  
00214  return 0;
00215 }
